attributes.action: replace the Independant Parliamentary Standards Authority with a more cost-effective expenses department which will not cost £6.6 million to set up and run
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The new Independant Parliamentary Standards Authority is a body which will set, check and authorise 646 MPs' expense claims. The money required to set this body up is £6.6 million. The price is down to the 80 staff which are apparently needed to run it along with the procurement of IT equipment. This is a scandalous waste of tax payers money and it needs to be stopped. Any private sector business could do the job for a fraction of the price so what's so different about Parliament?

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
